parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To send forward, accompany, equip for a journey. From pro and pempo; to send forward, i.e. Escort or aid in travel.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
Phoenicia, a northern coast strip of the Roman province Syria. From phoinix; palm-country; Phoenice, a region of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To narrate at length, declare. From ek and a compound of dia and hegeomai; to narrate through wholly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A turning (to God), conversion. From epistrepho; reversion, i.e. Morally, revolution.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
